name: A. Pythagorean Theorem II
statement:
In mathematics, the Pythagorean theorem is a relation in Euclidean
geometry among the three sides of a right-angled triangle. In terms of
areas, it states:The theorem can be written as an equation relating the
lengths of the sides , and , often called the Pythagorean equation:where
represents the length of the hypotenuse, and and represent the lengths
of the other two sides. Given , your task is to count how many
right-angled triangles with side-lengths , and that satisfied an
inequality .
editorial: This problem can be solve by brute-force, but it come up with a nicer solution if we involve some math.
